alert.note: Alert for Northeast Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued September 26 at 3:07PM EDT until September 27 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Up to 1/2 foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Northeast Suffolk County. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT tonight. * COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...Minor flooding is expected in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline late this afternoon into this evening in low lying, vulnerable areas. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns and homes/businesses with basements near the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...Breaking waves of 3 to 6 ft will result in beach erosion with minor damage possible to dune structures for Orient Point. Splashover bulkheads and dune structures may locally exacerbate flooding for shoreline roads and properties. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. PECONIC RIVER AT RIVERHEAD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.7 FT, MODERATE 6.4 FT, MAJOR 7.2 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.3 FT, MODERATE 3.0 FT, MAJOR 3.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 26/10 PM 5.6/ 6.1 2.2/ 2.7 2.4/ 2.9 1 MINOR 27/11 AM 5.2/ 5.7 1.8/ 2.3 1.9/ 2.4 1 NONE 27/11 PM 5.4/ 5.9 2.0/ 2.5 2.2/ 2.7 1 NONE ORIENT HARBOR AT ORIENT POINT NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.8 FT, MODERATE 5.8 FT, MAJOR 6.8 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.8 FT, MODERATE 2.8 FT, MAJOR 3.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 26/09 PM 4.6/ 5.1 1.6/ 2.0 1.5/ 1.9 3-5 MINOR 27/09 AM 4.0/ 4.5 1.0/ 1.5 0.9/ 1.4 2-4 NONE 27/09 PM 3.2/ 3.7 0.2/ 0.8 0.1/ 0.6 1-3 NONE FLAX POND AT OLD FIELD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 9.2 FT, MODERATE 10.2 FT, MAJOR 12.2 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.9 FT, MODERATE 2.9 FT, MAJOR 4.9 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 26/10 PM 8.9/ 9.4 1.6/ 2.0 1.3/ 1.8 2-3 MINOR 27/10 AM 8.3/ 8.8 1.0/ 1.5 0.7/ 1.1 2 NONE 27/10 PM 8.5/ 9.0 1.2/ 1.7 0.6/ 1.1 1 NONE &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
